back.text:
Root: و ي ل (W-Y-L)
Meaning: Woe, destruction
Pronunciation: Waylun
Tajweed Rules: **Layyin** on the 'وَيْ'.
Derived Words:
1. وَيْل (Wayl): Woe
Example Ayah: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ الْكِتَابَ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ

Root: ه م ز (H-M-Z)
Meaning: Slanderer
Pronunciation: Humazatin
Tajweed Rules: **Ghunna** on the tanween.
Derived Words:
1. هَمْز (Hamz): Slander
Example Ayah: This word is unique to this Surah in the Qur'an.

hint.text: The first person mentioned in the Surah's title.

back.text:
Root: ل م ز (L-M-Z)
Meaning: Backbiter
Pronunciation: Lumazatin
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the 'لّ'.
Derived Words:
1. لَمْز (Lamz): Backbiting
Example Ayah: الَّذِينَ يَلْمِزُونَ الْمُطَّوِّعِينَ

hint.text: The second type of person mentioned.

back.text:
Root: ج م ع (J-M-ʿ)
Meaning: Has gathered
Pronunciation: Jamaʿa
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. جَمْع (Jamʿ): Gathering
2. جُمُوع (Jumūʿ): Crowds
3. مَجْمَع (Majmaʿ): Place of gathering
Example Ayah: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ النَّاسِ

hint.text: The action of the wealthy person.

back.text:
Root: م و ل (M-W-L)
Meaning: Wealth, property
Pronunciation: Mālan
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on 'مَا'.
Derived Words:
1. مَال (Māl): Wealth
Example Ayah: الْمَالُ وَالْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا

hint.text: What the person gathered and counted.

back.text:
Root: ح ط م (Ḥ-Ṭ-M)
Meaning: The Crushing Fire
Pronunciation: Al-Ḥuṭamah
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words:
1. حُطَام (Ḥuṭām): Debris, broken pieces
2. حَطَمَ (Ḥaṭama): He smashed
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Surah in the Qur'an.

Root: و ق د (W-Q-D)
Meaning: The kindled, the lit
Pronunciation: Al-Mūqadah
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words:
1. وَقَدَ (Waqada): It burned
2. وَقُود (Waqūd): Fuel
Example Ayah: This word is primarily used in this Surah and the root is common elsewhere.

Root: ط ل ع (Ṭ-L-ʿ)
Meaning: It rises, it ascends
Pronunciation: Taṭṭaliʿu
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the 'طّ' and **Istiʿlā** on 'ط'.
Derived Words:
1. طَلَعَ (Ṭalaʿa): It rose
2. طُلُوع (Ṭulūʿ): Rising
Example Ayah: This verb is unique in this Surah.

hint.text: The action of the fire upon the hearts.

back.text:
Root: ف أ د (F-ʾ-D)
Meaning: The hearts (plural of fu'ād)
Pronunciation: Al-Afʾidah
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Layyin** on 'أَفْ'.
Derived Words:
1. فُؤَاد (Fuʾād): A heart
Example Ayah: وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ

hint.text: The internal organs affected by the Fire.

back.text:
Root: و ص د (W-Ṣ-D)
Meaning: Closed over, sealed
Pronunciation: Muʾṣadah
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the 'مّ'.
Derived Words:
1. وَصْد (Waṣd): A bolt, a door
Example Ayah: This word is unique in the Qur'an.

hint.text: A description of the Fire's state.

back.text:
Root: ع م د (ʿ-M-D)
Meaning: Pillars
Pronunciation: ʿAmadin
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. عَمُود (ʿAmūd): A pillar
2. اِعْتِمَاد (Iʿtimād): Reliance
Example Ayah: رَفَعَ السَّمَاوَاتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَوْنَهَا

hint.text: What the Fire is described with.

back.text:
Root: م د د (M-D-D)
Meaning: Extended, prolonged
Pronunciation: Mumaddadah
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the 'مّ' and 'دّ'.
Derived Words:
1. مَدّ (Madd): Extension
2. مَدِيد (Madīd): Extended
Example Ayah: فِي ظِلٍّ مُّمَدَّدٍ
